comments_since_last_sample.body: They will take everything that we allow them to. Don’t believe me? Ask those who died in war.
We don’t have a capitalist economy…

There's a difference between: kids choosing to work and kids having to work.

"Choosing to" means they don't have to, but they want to. It means the parents have them covered, so they work to do what they want with the money.

"Having to" means if they don't work, someone's going to starve in the family.

This doesn't go into that topic much, but what I'd be more concerned with employers paying kids "under the table". That is, paying kids in cash; meaning they're not in the business' books, skirting child labor laws. Kids that "have to" are the ones exploited in this case.

Still, I don't mind when people say stuff like this about US capitalism. If US capitalism could achieve Universal Healthcare, Universal Basic Income, Affordable Housing, and some other things I'm forgetting now, there wouldn't be a lot of criticism from me.

But, looking at the trajectory of where that style of capitalism is going, especially when scheiße politicians like Manchin can dwindle climate change policy to less than a trillion, it's not going to work for much longer.

Republicans' homes are going to be overrun by the ocean, only to blame themselves and who they voted for. Then again, they'll probably collect some flood insurance money, so I guess there's that to look forward to for them (if their insurance company can cover them all).

It's hilarious because capitalism is still working fine. It's just that the ultra rich are unbelievably fucking greedy.

Things would be status quo if they just gave a bit more to their employees and they could continue to exploit us all for more billions. But they're greed has made everyone hit a "fuck it" point.

I’m on a road trip rn. I went to Burger King yesterday and they had to close the place down right after we ordered because there was only one employee on shift. He had to  take orders and then go cook the food. It took way longer than normal and I didn’t mind one bit. If I had to eat the apples the I packed instead of fries I would not have cared a bit. I hope these workers keep quitting. Force a change.

>Over the summer school board members in the Waukesha school district made headlines after they voted to leave a federal free meals program because they worried it made it easy for families to “become spoiled” or develop an “addiction” to the service. Imagine if kids became addicted to the government ensuring they didn’t starve, eh?

This is at the core of why the wealthy don't like government. In their minds they fund all of government and it all goes to spoilt poors who can't afford it on their own. 

If those poors take too much of a liking to government and government services they are sure to keep voting for tax increases so that more services can be provided. 

The wealthy would provide that the government do three basic things. Protect their wealth, promote their business interests, and protect them personally against their own actions. 

It's amazing how this message is being parroted at school board meetings now and is taking food from kids mouths to protect the accumulated wealth of a few.
It was clear the current version of capitalism isn't working when they started selling you on "trickle Down".
Have they tried paying the one guy at the top less and everyone else a bit more?
